page.title: 14Farming in Stithians Facts
page.content: Farming in Stithians is not particularly hard because the climate is usually mild. It is mainly dairy farming but there are some beef cattle. The size of farms vary from 20 acres to 220 acres. Some farms keep bulls and some use artificial insemination. Some farm machinery is hired but most farms own at least one diesel tractor. Farms are mostly worked by the family members with a little paid help. Temporary workers are brought in to help store the silage. There is some cultivation of spring barley and corn which is stored and fed to the cattle in the winter. There are about 11 farms in Stithians. The price of milk is about 11.5p per litre. The farmers we spoke to all thought it was the only way to earn a living and wanted their children to follow this career.
